result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley J. Obarski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All 3 cases called @ 3:18 PM: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court with Defendant, Bradley J. Obarski.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by ADA.  Def and Counsel concur with recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.   Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  14CM-480 Plea Ct 1 (CCW):  NC  14CM-433 Plea Ct 1 (OWI 2) Plea:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  14CM-433 Ct 2 DRI.  14CM-480  Ct 2 DRI.  15CM-225 DRI.  Uncharged referral for potential BJump from FDL Co relating to Citation issued, Case No. 15TR-6541, with offense date of 7/4/2015 also DRI.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Appreciates Def's comments and accepts Joint resolution offered.  Both Counts - S/W - 2 yrs probation.  OWI 2nd only:  5 days WCJ, GT, Huber Privileges, 2 days TS credit, Report 10/1/2015 at 8:00 pm; AODA and any follow thru,  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; 12 mos DL Rev; IID for 12 mos; Costs Only as to 14CM-80 - 60 DTP or PP.  Fine as to OWI of $1379.00. Appeal Rights Given.  As to IID - Def asks the Court for exemption on joint vehicle owned.  Court advises Def that he cannot operate a vehicle that is not equipped with IID.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Bradley J. Obarski in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi some issues to discuss but potential resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

BOND ORDERED AS TO WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2014CM000433, 2014CM000480 and 2015CM000225:  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the method of operation.

ADDRESS INFO for Bradley J. Obarski
Current: N4830 22nd Ave, Wild Rose, WI 54984 United States  (Effective: 06-24-2015)
Prior: 619 S. Evergreen Street, Wautoma, WI 54982

14CM-433 and 14CM-480 - Both Cases Called @ 1:21 PM: Defendant Bradley J. Obarski in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA states nonappearance and removal of the previously scheduled Final PTC and cancellation of Jury Trial.  ADA argues as to Bond - now 3 pending files which includes a new case in 15CM-225.  State argues for Cash Bond w/conditions.  SPD argues as to bond.  SPD states oversight occurred and explains difficulties with communication with Def.  Def had turned himself in to satisfy the warrant.  Argues for previous bond to remain as ordered.  Court notes previous bond ordered forfeited.  The Court:  Impressed with Def's contact with counsel and the fact that he voluntarily turned himself in.  Court orders a $2500 Signature Bond as previous bond forfeited - all previous conditions to remain in place with No Op w/o Valid DL.  15CM-225:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  SPD admits receipt from DA's office.    NGP received and entered as to new matter.  One single bond for all 3 cases.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Def is released from summons issued for 7/28 return.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 10:05 am.
